description:
The year is 1983. Your helicopter has had to make an emergency landing in Africa, but you've landed in an exceptionally dangerous place: the village where Donkey Kong's descendants live. You've been chased up into a palm tree and are hanging on a rope, but the apes aren't going to leave you be, so you're going to have to defend yourself!

Donkey Gorilla is a basic action game where the player controls the stranded character hanging from a rope tied between palm trees. On the ground are a number of primates, and they must be eliminated before they can climb the tree and cut the rope. There is also a bat that flies overhead, attacking from above, but will sometimes fly low enough to be shot. Only a direct hit to the head will kill an ape, and if the player is killed either by the apes or the bat above, all apes on that stage will return. If the player can eliminate all the apes, then play continues on the next stage with a different formation of apes.

sample_screenshots.caption: An ape is climbing the tree
Shoot the apes, they apparently deserve it

title: Donkey Gorilla

description: Dōjin Kaizokuban is an unofficial text-mode remake of Truxton. It includes many recognizable elements from the original game, including the three types of weapons, enemy patterns, and even the large bosses that can be destroyed piece-by-piece, all rendered in chunky blue-and-white text. Just as the original game, there are three weapon types, each of them upgradable, as well as screen-clearing bombs (which look like flashing skulls), and multiple stages each with a boss at the end. The game also features a bizarre running commentary on the side of the screen by a square-headed face.

sample_screenshots.caption: The tubes on the sides will shoot back only if you destroy them

title: Doujin Kaizokuban

description: Choro Q Holiday Puzzle is a simple sliding tile puzzle game based on Takara's popular line of miniature toy cars. It features only a single picture to unscramble, but offers four different difficulty settings (which change the size of the pieces), as well as one crucial difference with most other puzzles of this type: each of the three light colors in the puzzle is scrambled and must be solved separately, and the player can freely switch between moving the red, green, and blue pieces around the board.

sample_screenshots.caption: Unscrambled a part of the puzzle...sometimes it's hard to find the pieces you need
Starting the beginner difficulty...kinda looks like you need 3D glasses for this

title: Choro Q Holiday Puzzle

description:
Shiryō Sensen - War of the Dead: Browning no Fukkatsu is based on the original MSX release of War of the Dead. The two versions are similar in terms of concept, story, graphical style, and general gameplay mechanics, but significantly differ in several aspects.

The world map layout of this version is completely different from that of the original version. Several locations have been altered, removed, or added. The pacing has been therefore considerably changed, as the protagonist has to travel different distances; some of the main quests involving rescuing the survivors have also been altered. The map is more open and less maze-like; the fires blocking the path in many spaces have been completely removed. The PC-88 version also removes the day/night cycle and the ability to sleep.

Gameplay-wise, this version has underwent some simplification. Laila can only fight one enemy at a time, and enemies attack less frequently, which drastically lowers the difficulty level. Guns now have infinite ammunition. However, some of the enemies have developed resistances to certain weapons, so switching weapons during the battles has become a necessity.

Graphically, the two versions are rather similar; the PC-88 version has more detailed graphics and animation, but no backgrounds for the battles.

sample_screenshots.caption: Killed by a vicious... err... hanging thing
Changing weapons while fighting... legs with a tumor?..

title: Shiryō Sensen - War of the Dead: Browning no Fukkatsu

description:
The prophet Nostradamus has foreseen that the world as we know it shall end in the year 1999, and the thousand-year kingdom of angels and children will commence. A young boy named Shou is at first unaware of these prophecies, enjoying a normal life with his sweetheart Alisa. However, a series of events changes his life forever, as he is entrusted with the task of saving humans by discovering the ancient continent of Atlantis.

1000-nen Ōkoku is an adventure game viewed from first-person perspective. Navigation and interaction with the environment is performed by selecting verb commands from a menu and combining them with objects selected from a list. Though the game largely follows a puzzle-less Japanese format, the commands include (beside the traditional "Examine", "Talk", and "Move") options such as "Take" and "Buy", requiring interaction with items.

sample_screenshots.caption: My friend, you know what I suggest to you? A decent haircut

title: 1000-nen Ōkoku

description:
Despite its title, Combat Simulator: Battle Gorilla has nothing to do with the well-known large African primates, but rather with guerrilla combat. It is a top-down action game that has certain similarities with Commando, but with a much more tactical approach and extended simulation elements.

Before the combat begins, the player selects one of the eight available maps. Each map features different terrain, enemy types, and overall difficulty level. The player has the option to scout the map in a safe mode before the actual battle. It is also necessary to equip the protagonist with various kinds of firearms. Precise characteristics of each weapons are displayed, so that the player is able to outfit the hero fittingly for the upcoming operation.

The combat itself is tactical, having a nearly turn-based element: all the action is paused whenever the protagonist stops moving. Enemy units consist of soldiers equipped with various types of firearms, tanks, and (in some maps) planes and combat helicopters. Enemy soldiers would position themselves behind cover or in fortified locations, sit in trenches, try to surround the hero, etc. Both the protagonist and the enemies can swim, with the speed visibly decreased.
title: Combat Simulator: Battle Gorilla

description:
The inhabitants of the planet Rhea are being terrorized by a mysterious organization known as Hell Stones. To save his people, the king of Rhea himself steps out of his palace in order to single-handedly avert the threat.

The Scheme is an action game with role-playing and light platforming elements. The player controls the king as he explores vast outdoor and indoor environments. While some locations are simple side-scrolling areas, others are built like large mazes with platforming segments - the king has to jump on platforms to access certain areas or avoid enemy attacks; however, he doesn't take falling damage. Enemies respawn after the protagonist leaves the screen and returns. The king shoots energy orbs at the enemies; their type can be changed and upgraded as the game advances.

The role-playing element is present in levels and character development. Enemies leave two kinds of power-ups upon defeat: life-restoring and force-increasing, the latter being roughly equivalent to experience points. Leveling up occurs after accumulating certain amounts of these power-ups, increasing the main character's hit points. It is often required to level up in order to be able to access areas with harder enemies or defeat bosses.

sample_screenshots.caption: This looks like a giant sand clock or something
I've always had great admiration for horse heads
Boss battle. The hero is almost killed, hence the funky colors

title: The Scheme

description:
A young private detective named Mike Steel has opened a new office in Santa Chris, California. One day, a distinguished-looking elderly couple arranges an interview with him. It appears that their granddaughter is presumed dead, but the body has never been found. The couple hires Mike to search for the missing body; but as the detective begins to investigate the matter, he realizes that there is a much bigger conspiracy behind that.

Burning Point is a mystery-themed adventure game. The game does not have the usual set of simple verb commands with object lists, which is common for Japanese adventures. Instead, it offers specific options at each screen (though most of them repeat themselves as Mike goes about his investigation). The player has to interview suspects, unlock new locations (which, in their turn, deliver new suspects), as well as gather and examine evidence in order to advance the story and solve the case.

sample_screenshots.caption: Hi to you too! Alone in the library, so late?..

title: Burning Point

description:
Daisuke's girlfriend Kasumi has asked him to write music for lyrics she's written, and being the upstanding young man he is, he accepts. Toiling for three days on the song, he finally finishes and can't wait to play it for Kasumi! He heads off to Kasumi's house and rings the bell, but her father answers and tells Daisuke that she hasn't returned from school yet. Moments later again, the phone rings. Kasumi has been kidnapped! Her father gives Daisuke a small UFO for some reason, and he rushes off to save her!

Hole Chaser is a simple action game where the player must guide a rather unruly-to-operate UFO to the end of a maze. It will bounce off any hazards in the stage, and can't be crushed, but there is a strict time limit for each stage. Fail to complete the stage in time, and it's game over. Reach the goal, and the player is shown a short scene of Kasumi being sexually assaulted by her captor. The scenes get continually more explicit as the game progresses. There are six stages total, as well as a music mode for listening to the BGM.

sample_screenshots.caption: The stages get noticeably more difficult to maneuver around in

title: Hole Chaser

description:
After having traveled to two magical realms, the hero was finally able to leave the world of Elderein and return to his own world, Luizard. However, upon his arrival he discovered that his travels have caused a time slip of several billion years. His world is now being threatened by the God of Darkness. He must use the Heart of Phantasm he found during his first adventure, and locate other heroes who would aid him on his quest and liberate the land.

Mugen no Shinzō III is in many ways quite different from its Ultima-inspired predecessor. Story progression is more linear, exploration more restricted; characters with their own backgrounds join the party, taking a cue from Japanese RPG design. However, the game doesn't have anime aesthetics characteristic of these games. Enemies are visibly roaming the overworld and dungeons; an encounter leads to a separate top-down battle screen, on which combat proceeds in real time, unless the player interferes and manually assigns commands to the characters.

sample_screenshots.caption: Zombies! Or "bionoids", as the game calls them
On the world map. Capital city looks a bit like Moscow

title: Mugen no Shinzō III

description:
Chátty is the third entry in System Sacom's Novel Ware series. It was meant to be the second title, but delays during development pushed its release date past that of the would-be third game. Its story is set in the future and involves a man who was framed for a crime he did not commit. In attempt to clear his name, the protagonist discovers a device that allows interdimensional travel, and ventures into a parallel dimension in search for answers.

Unlike the previous Novel Ware game, Chátty is a more traditional Japanese-style adventure, with fewer and shorter conversations and text descriptions. Interaction with the environment and navigation are performed by selecting verb commands and combining them with objects from a menu list. There are no real puzzles, but it is possible to pick up objects, use them, and examine them in an inventory.

sample_screenshots.caption: The title screen comes in different varieties. This is one of them...
You can change the shades of the graphics, and move around windows

title: Chátty

description: Jehard is a simple action role-playing game. The Holy Ark was stolen by a powerful demon king, and it's up to the lone hero to retrieve it. The game world mostly consists of overhead maze-like hostile areas. The player navigates the protagonist and fights enemies by "bumping" into them, similarly to Ys. Experience points are awarded for vanquishing enemies. Basic equipment and special items can be found throughout the course of the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: An ultra-high-level character proudly explores a bluish dungeon

title: Jehard

description: Kyan Kyan Collection is a computer adaptation of the Japanese card game Daifugō / Daihinmin (known in English-speaking countries as Scum, President, and other names). The objective of the game is to get rid of all cards dealt to the player by progressively playing higher cards one at a turn. The player competes against four AI-controlled female opponents. Although all four participate in every round, the player must select one of the girls in the beginning of the game as the main adversary. Her picture will be displayed during the rounds and she will gradually undress as she loses.

sample_screenshots.caption: Close to a win against this athletic girl

title: Kyan Kyan Collection

description: Star Struck is a horizontally-scrolling shoot-em-up. The player controls a spaceship with the mission of eliminating "flying objects". The entire game takes place in space. The game is divided into stages, but backgrounds remain the same, and the stages are differentiated by the amount of encountered enemies, and in some cases also their type. There are no power-ups or secondary weapons; the player-controlled ship can only us the default laser shot. Stand-out features include bombs that release multiple bullets only when shot at, and so-called "formation attacks" in which different types of enemies (usually headed by a stronger unique foe) team up to assault the protagonist.
title: Star Struck

description:
Long time ago, there was a land known as Bawnded. On one fateful day, the castle of the Adon country fell through the Earth. Humans had to face hostile creatures lurking there, and a brave adventurer came forth to protect them, venturing into the depths of unknown lands.

Bawnded: Chitei Sekai-hen is predominantly a role-playing game with interactive fiction elements. The game offers simple character management, with hit points, strength and endurance parameters, as well as equipment. It is required to type text commands to interact with the environment. Much of the challenge lies in navigating maze-like first-person environments.
title: Bawnded: Chitei Sekai-hen

description:
In Panorama Toh the player assumes the role of an adventurer who is entrusted with the task of traveling to a beautiful island and liberating it from monsters. The game is closest to the role-playing format, albeit with several distinguishing features. The player character has hit points and stamina statistics, can equip weapons and armor, find or win gold in battles and purchase items. The top-down overworld is comparatively small, but has to be navigated with care: there are various kinds of enemies and traps to be found there. Whenever something of interest occurs a very small separate window is displayed in the corner of the screen, showing for example the positioning of the enemies or the nature of the trap.

The player interacts with the environment by pressing keys corresponding to commands; it is often necessary to outsmart enemies or even jump in certain instances. Dungeons are done is first-person pseudo-3D. The game flows in real time and the protagonist will eventually die of hunger and fatigue if the player is not careful enough.

sample_screenshots.caption: Main menu + the main playable area

title: Panorama Toh

description:
Epsilon3 is a sci-fi shooter with role-playing elements. The inhabitants of the planet Mu are planning to eradicate all organic life in the universe. To counter that, humans initiated project Epsilon3, sending the most skillful mecha fighter to three cities that must be liberated at first. The player can choose to start in any of the cities, which vary in difficulty. In spite of being called so, the cities in reality mainly consist of vast wilderness areas with a few abstract blocks representing non-interactive buildings.

The game is viewed in first-person pseudo-3D and is monochrome; the player can choose any color for the world and the enemies. The latter appear randomly, initiating combat sequences. The player character cannot move during battles or escape from them. Combat is action-based, resembling arcade shooters. It is necessary to aim and sometimes hit the enemy's weakpoint to succeed. There is a variety of weapons divided into two categories: beam (plasma, laser, etc.) and launcher (rocket, missile, etc.), assigned to respective keys during combat. Weapons and their ammunition can be acquired after successfully defeating enemies. The player character is also awarded experience points and grows stronger.

sample_screenshots.caption: Trying to hit this pesky moving guy

title: Dimensional Fighter Epsilon3

description:
Three dragons suddenly appeared in the magical world of Forfaral. Five princesses of five countries constituting the realm, entrusted with the protection of the sacred light, were abducted. The hero, chosen by the magicians as the carrier of the legendary Still Sword, must venture into each country, now overrun by vicious monsters, rescue the princesses and defeat the fiends.

Still Sword is an overhead action dungeon crawler. The player character explores maze-like environments populated by wandering enemies. Defeating them yields experience points, gold, as well as random items such as weapons, equipment, or healing potions. Special rooms contain plot-related boss enemies that must be vanquished in order to move on to the next segment.

sample_screenshots.caption: Harder enemies and teleporters await you
After intense leveling up you meet a boss who can still decimate you
Moving on to more complex passages

title: Still Sword

description:
For years, the magical realm of Forfaral existed in balance thanks to the power of five princesses, protectors of its land. However, the evil sorceress Inkoma abducted the princesses and locked them in castles populated by monsters. It is up to a brave female warrior to rescue the princesses and restore peace.

Still Sword for Adult is very similar to its non-hentai counterpart visually and gameplay-wise. Like the previous game, it is an action RPG in which the protagonist explores maze-like passages and fights monsters for experience, money, and items. An added twist in this installment are erotic lesbian scenes that occur whenever the protagonist liberates the princesses.

sample_screenshots.caption: Gameplay might remind you of Gauntlet by without the firepower.

title: Still Sword for Adult

description: In Teiō no Yabō the player controls a young man whose girlfriend Alisa was abducted. The trail leads to the girls' high school, where the protagonist encounters suspicious guards and murderous female students. Although it contains RPG-like features such as turn-based battles and rudimentary statistics for the player character (hit points along with strength and defense parameters), the gameplay is much closer to the adventure format. The player visits various locations and interacts with objects by combining them with a selected verb from a text menu. Certain items have to be found and used in appropriate situations. Battles are scripted and the player is unable to raise the attributes of the protagonist though his own choices or actions. Opponents undress and assume erotic poses when defeated.

sample_screenshots.caption: Obligatory sexy teacher - before the battle...

title: Teiō no Yabō

description:
The Quasar Empire needed to expand in order to provide enough living space for its inhabitants. They sent a scout to the neighboring Beta Galaxy, with whom they had signed a peace treaty before. However, Beta authorities treated the scout with suspicion, fearing that Quasar Empire would break the treaty and assault them to further their goals. On the way back the scout was killed. A member of a special team known as the Anti-Intruder Rangers is sent to space with a clear objective: find the scout's remains and retrieve the vital information he carried.

AIR is primarily an action game with exploration and light role-playing elements. The player controls a tank-like space vehicle, moving from first-person perspective on planet surfaces. Several planets can be accessed and explored in any order. Contact with an enemy takes the player to a separate overhead screen where the battle takes place. The player must navigate the tank, shooting at the enemy and avoiding its attacks. Money is awarded, which can be spent to purchase more torpedoes and missiles, as well as repair the tank and buy new shields and batteries for it.

sample_screenshots.caption: Battle against a slime of sorts

title: AIR

description:
Years ago, a book containing clues to the whereabouts of an enormous treasure was written. The book was lost, but one person managed to get a hold on a portion of it. The young adventurer Refrain teams up with the magician Ria and their friends Groom and Gadem, embarking on a journey that will hopefully lead to riches and glory.

Alseides is a Japanese-style adventure game. Controlling Refrain, the player has to go through the commands Look, Talk, Use and Think (often combined with people or objects from a sub-menu) in order to advance to the next location and scene. Sometimes Refrain would be prompted to make a choice (usually following a Yes/No question). Wrong choices would then lead to Game Over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Hmm, how can I pass here?..
Guess I chose the wrong way

title: Alseides: Ushinawareta Zaihō

description: Angels is a very short Japanese-style adventure game starring Celica, a high school student with extraordinary powers (including levitation) who is sworn to protect the innocent. The school is attacked by a gang and Celica must rescue hostages and defeat the villains using her powers. Gameplay-wise, this is achieved by going through typical verb commands (Examine, Talk, etc.) in a few scenes, after which the game turns into a non-interactive string of cutscenes, some of which are animated.
title: Angels: Celica Crisis

description:
A powerful earthquake in the Shinjuku area of Tokyo released waves of horrifying monsters that had been hiding within the depths of Earth. The city was destroyed, and only a few humans survived. A team of fighters was assembled in an underground complex and sent to fight the monsters on the surface. One of these fighters was imbued with special psionic powers and was entrusted with a mission of utmost importance.

Ashe is a side-view shooter with some platforming elements. The player can explore several interconnected areas, though certain locations can only be accessed in a specific order, after having fulfilled other objectives or acquired the necessary items. The player character uses his psionic ability to shoot energy balls at enemies, which causes his ESP level to be gradually depleted. Certain areas require jumping or climbing on structures to bypass.
title: Ashe

description: Assorted Friendship is an erotic adventure starring a school girl named Kanako, who is dreaming of a sexual experience and is trying to seduce her female friend. The gameplay follows the Japanese adventure format, with commands such as Look and Talk appearing during most scenes, with other context-specific actions popping up from time to time. There are no object sub-menus and the plot will usually advance after only a few commands have been selecting. There are also a few optional scenes and paths to take in the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: ...and recreate it with your friend afterwards
Here you can choose where to go
In the class. Trying to impress a male teacher this time

title: Assorted Friendship

description: Aya-chan World is a simple top-down arcade-style racing game. The player controls a car, steering it through twisted, maze-like passages, adjusting the view so that the car always faces north. All the races are against time; if the player runs out of time allotted for the stage the game is over. Successfully making it to the finish line within the time limit, however, leads to erotic pictures of a young woman undressing and assuming sexual poses.

sample_screenshots.caption: You have successfully completed the first stage
This stage begins in a confusing field
The reward for completing the second stage

title: Aya-chan World

description:
Ayumi had been an ordinary Japanese teenage girl - until one day, when summer vacation was just about to begin, a strange creature appeared and told her that a parallel world is in danger. Only Ayumi can stop the evil warlock Baram and his monster minions, since the inhabitants of the other world consider her a goddess incarnate.

Ayumi is an adventure game with comical and slight erotic undertones. Interaction with the environment is performed by selecting commands (such as Examine, Ask, Take etc.) from a menu. However, unlike most Japanese adventures, navigation is done in a RPG-like fashion on a top-down world map, with individual locations represented as icons. The game allows a considerable degree of exploration, though some areas are inaccessible until certain conditions are met. As opposed to most Japanese adventures, the story progresses by solving problems (which usually involves procuring items and using them in another context) rather then simply by triggering events. There are also a few puzzles in the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: This blacksmith will give you some weapons later on

title: Ayumi

description:
Bandits 9 is a turn-based tactical game starring the titular nine bandits in the course of two scenarios. In the first, they plan to invade a kingdom and abduct its princess for ransom money; in the second, they are trying to escape from the top of a heavily guarded castle with the princess in their midst. The player can choose any of the two scenarios from the main menu.

The gameplay consists of large-scale tactical battles composed of several interconnected areas each. Movement is entirely turn-based, and attacks can be executed when hostile characters are on adjacent fields. There are no separate battle screens or combat animation. Each bandit has their own attributes and can equip various weapons and armor, but there are no levels and the characters remain constant in strength.

sample_screenshots.caption: A more coordinated assault on the castle

title: Bandits 9

description: Bargon no Paka-paka Shōbōken is an adventure game in which the player controls a male character who travels to a tower dungeon without an apparent reason. The game has no stated goal other than unlock different areas in the tower and beneath by procuring the necessary items. Unlike most Japanese-made adventures, it is viewed from an overhead perspective and does not feature any interaction menu. The player must navigate the protagonist through the corridors of the tower, talking to characters who would usually request an item and give you another one in return. Items are used automatically whenever the player character is at the appropriate location. There is no combat or any other challenges in the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: One of the very few times when you can actually make a choice

title: Bargon no Paka-paka Shōbōken

description: Galactic Wars is a space-themed real-time strategy game. It takes place in the year 2432 somewhere in the Milky Way galaxy and depicts a battle between the Galactic Alliance and an alien fleet, revolving around the strategically important planet M23. The game puts the player in control of a starfleet commander who has two spacecraft at his disposal: the Falcon and the Unicon. The entire game is controlled with menu commands. The player can change the course as well as offensive and defensive manoeuvres of the spaceships, and deploy fighters on the planet itself. The game proceeds in real time: if the player fails to choose a menu command within a short period of time his turn will be over and the enemies will execute their own manoeuvres.
title: Galactic Wars 1

description: Zoom in Space is a simple arcade-style shooting game whose pseudo-3D perspective and ship designs are both modeled after Buck Rogers: Planet of Zoom. Armed with simple twin-shot cannons, you move your ship vertically and side-to-side while enemies approach from up ahead to ram you. Only one enemy sprite can appear at a time, so the next attacker will only appear once the current ship has been successfully dodged or shot. Three types of enemy ships attack in a never-ending loop, and the game's only goal is to attain a high score by shooting down as many as possible before losing all three of your lives.

sample_screenshots.caption: Firing at a distant saucer; it's handy none of the enemies can fire back.
A bird-like ship approaches from the distance...

title: Zoom in Space

description:
Once upon a time, a fairy accidentally dropped a magic crystal that governs good and evil. Unfortunately, it lands in the hands of the demon Great Maou Gaudius (also known as "Gaudius the Great Satan"), who uses the power of the crystal to kill most of the population and further devastate their cities; even going so far as to turn the plants and soil into poison. It is up to the lord Aros di Gran to save the land, by collecting four "Fire Crystals" and challenging Gaudius for control over the more powerful crystal.

Action takes place from a side view, action platforming perspective. Your character's primary means of attack are projectiles, with some additional items to be picked up over the course of your adventure serving to expand your character's arsenal. Flip-screen transitions cause enemies to respawn immediately upon exiting / re-entering certain screens, making some of the vertical platforming particularly challenging. While the game does boast above-average sprite work for the platform, the stilted animation and movements can often render the game difficult to visually parse.
title: Legend

description: Paladin is a side scrolling Action RPG where players take the role of a paladin who goes through 100 stages to find 3 magical swords and rescue a princess from a villain called "God". In between some of the levels, players can buy weapons, armor and medicine in shops, as well as rest in hospitals. Players can also use magic to inflict more damage on their enemies.

sample_screenshots.caption: In between each level you can save or load your game.
The first level. The gameplay is pretty straightforward. Kill all the enemies and get from point A to point B.
There's no game over screen. Your hero becomes a tombstone just like his enemies.

title: Paladin

description: Chobin is a simple arcade game starring a Tanuki. Players control the cute protagonist and throw a bouncing ball to stun their enemies. The ball can harm the Tanuki as well so players must not get too close to walls if they wish to survive. The enemies can also throw their own balls to defeat the Tanuki. The Tanuki's objective is to rescue the children that are being held hostage in the building. To do that, he must descend to the first floor of the building and defeat the King Chobin.

sample_screenshots.caption: The first level. Note that the enemies can also attack you.

title: Chobin

description: Another winner of Bothtec's first programming contest, Free Way is a 3D racing game where players drive a car as a spy who is meant to bring a state-of-the-art car to a secret laboratory in Technopolis. Due to the player's role (Or, perhaps, poor AI), most drivers on the road seem to deliberately try to crash into the player's car making players rely on the brakes once they get too close. Players need to reach the end of the level within a certain period of time while avoiding the drivers on their path. Reaching checkpoints will give players extra time to complete the level. On the road to Technopolis, players will see an 8-bit rendition of buildings, amusement parks, Mt. Fuji, the Golden Gate Bridge and other sights to behold. Can the spy get to Technopolis safely?
title: Free Way

description: Space Diamond is a vertical shooter set in 2301. Players will manipulate the love plane VICTOPE, shoot down the enemies that appear one after another, and will have an adventure looking for a diamond that is reported to be worth over 100 billion dollars.

sample_screenshots.caption: The sound is pretty basic so thank you for thinking about my ears.

title: Space Diamond

description:
In the year 2991 AD, the Galactic Federal Government agreed to a full-scale disarmament treaty with the Andromeda nation and it looked like the galaxy would finally be at peace. However, just before the signing of the treaty, members of the military-industrial complex, who were opposed to the treaty, carried out a coup d'etat to prevent this. Colonel Iritsa Renina, commander of the Beta Unit of the Galactic Federation, refused to help the coup and ordered the rebellion to be suppressed. The object of the game is that you, the Beta Unit ace pilot, Ensign Rova Trotskyna must destroy the federal facility that was occupied in the coup.

Final Crisis: Terrestrial Defense Police is a side-scrolling shoot'em up. You start with a standard firepower, but by shooting certain enemies it may leave items that can give you different weapons like the standard shot, homing shots or the laser. Throughout the game you have the option to choose which one you want to use as main weapon.

The Letter A increases your rate of fire and then you can hold down the button to use the turbo fire. The P of power-up gives you two pods on the sides that fire simultaneously. Sometimes there are items that give back some energy. There are also rare items that will give you full health or an extra life.

You start with three lives and once they are lost it's game over but you can choose if you want to use a continue to get back where you last died.
title: Final Crisis: Terrestrial Defense Police

description: Strategic Confrontation: Map Collection is an add-on for Daisenryaku II: Campaign Version. It adds several additional maps which resemble real-life locations.
title: Daisenryaku II: Campaign Version Map Collection

description:
Moritan no Battle Field is a two-player turn-based strategy game set on a fixed 41x41 square game map. There are four types of military units: infantry, tank, fighter plane and bomber, each of which have different combat effectiveness against the other unit types. The map is symmetrical, and divided into 16 territories, 14 of which are neutral at the start of the game. The aim of each player is to take over areas to provide resources for buying more military units, and to eventually force the capture of the opponent's home base.

At any point in the game, you have five options (selected using the function keys F1-F5). You may move a unit, attack, supply or purchase a unit, or end your turn. Units may be selected using the arrow keys, and are moved one square at a time vertically, horizontally or diagonally on the grid. The different units have different movement capability over the different terrain types. Tanks can only be used in open areas. Infantry move less quickly, but can enter forest squares and are the only unit that can be used to take over cities if they end their turn on that square. Fighters and bombers can fly above all terrain, but need to be regularly re-supplied to prevent them from falling out of the sky.

sample_screenshots.caption: The computer's bomber has annihilated my infantry.

title: Moritan no Battle Field

description:
Valna is an RPG that incorporates traditional JRPG (turn-based) and action-RPG elements.

The game takes place in Uniterion, on the night of the 100th anniversary of the Kingdom. The Chief Priest Zaurzarius kills the king and also all of his servants. However, the young Princess Melfia is rescued by the hands of Guard Captain Riatos. From then on, the world is desolate and turned into a monster's nest. The brave Deal Garat sets out on a journey in search of the legendary crystal to resolve this. Many years later, Deal's son Kamil visits the Kingdom of Uniterion in search of his father's whereabouts. This is where the game starts, with the player playing as Kamil.

In towns there is a side view and the battles are turn-based, like in traditional JRPGs. Here the player can also rest at inns, buy weapons and armor and talk to some people. Outside of towns, in the overworld and in dungeons, the view is overhead and the battles are in real-time action. The player also gets ranged spells which they can fire. Killed enemies may sometimes leave gold or HP gems behind, the latter will refill HP - sometimes even to the max.

Valna also incorporates System Sacom's Novel Wware system.

sample_screenshots.caption: In towns the battles are turn-based
Overworld; the combat is real-time here

title: Valna

description:
A girl named Meo was going to play when suddenly the sky became dark and it started to rain. She decides to take shelter from the rain in a nearby house. Upon entry she answers the telephone which says: "I'd like to give you a wonderful present, your death...!!". Now it's up to Meo to defeat the master of the house - devil, and find a way out.

Meo's Mystery Adventure is a text adventure with graphics. The player must input combinations of verb commands and objects in order to interact with the environment and use inventory items to solve puzzles. All the commands are in English, plus most of the text descriptions are in English as well.

sample_screenshots.caption: Ran into a witch, this is an optional encounter
You play 3D ping pong against the witch, if you lose you die
If you win Mr. Question will give you parts to assemble a golden gun

title: Meo's Mystery Adventure

description: Minky-Momo Panicball is an action game featuring the main character from the anime TV series Magical Princess Minky Momo. Balls drop from the sky, and then bounce around the screen. You control the princess, who can move left, right or jump. She can either catch the ball in a basket she is carrying in front of her, or continue to let it bounce and wait for another to fall. Catching a ball gives you points. But after it has bounced around for a while and there are more on the screen you will get more points per ball. Being hit by a ball will knock you out, and lose one of your three lives. Extra lives are earned by completing a level, which consists of a fixed number of balls. Later levels are distinguished only by different colours, increased frequency of ball drops, and requiring a greater number of balls caught for completion.
title: Minky-Momo Panicball

description:
Cuby Panic is an action puzzle game where the goal is to grab all the keys and then head to the exit (the clear cubes), while dodging the moving cubes.

There is also an editor mode where custom levels can be created.

sample_screenshots.caption: Title screen & Main menu (the letters P/C/F/S/L/K on the right)

title: Cuby Panic

description: Monster Land is an action top-down maze game, resembling Pac-man. You play as Ban, who travels the perilous labyrinths in search of gems, while being pursued by monsters of various types. The maze contains obstacles such as piles of skulls, which much not be touched, and some force-fields that prevent monsters from passing, but do not affect Ban. There are many items in the maze. Rings, orbs and potions can be retrieved for bonus points. A fist icon will temporarily give Ban the ability to destroy the monsters. But the main objective is to collect all of the gems, which completes the level and takes you to the next.

sample_screenshots.caption: All but one of the gems captured on level 3.
The monsters run after Ban activates a power-up.

title: Monster Land

description: Seiko-chan SOS is an adult themed arcade shooter. Seiko has been captured by robots, and it is up to you to free her. Robots appear one at a time in a large rectangular arena. They are stationary when they appear, but can randomly and suddenly teleport to other parts of the screen. You control a cross-hair, that you can use to target and shoot the robot, which is only vulnerable in the chest area. If you shoot a certain number of robots within 3 minutes, Seiko will demonstrate her appreciation by showing herself, sans an item of clothing. Failure to destroy all of the robots by the time limit will end the game.
title: Seiko-chan SOS

description: Gomimushi-kun is an action game where you play as a trash bug collecting trash in Info City while avoiding a sweeper and truck roaming around and you can stun the enemies with your breath, but you have a time limit which is your energy and it only works on the sweeper and not the truck, if you get hit by any of them or run out of time you'll lose a life. The more trash you pick up the more increase in the speed of the enemies. You can get an extra life when you reach 10000 points.
title: Gomimushi-kun

description:
Horror House is Falcom's first graphical text adventure and the first installment in the Falcom Occultic Mystery Adventure series in which Mr. F sends you a request. In the house they were planning to move into a ghost suddenly appeared. They asked you to investigate. The object of the game is to enter the mansion where psychic phenomena occur and find out its secrets, as per the request.

The commands to be given is expressed in Japanese in katakana: "noun" + "space" + "verb". For example, to pick up a lighter that fell on the floor, type "TAKE LIGHTER" (ライター トル). To navigate through the locations type "GO LEFT" (ヒダリ　ユク), "GO RIGHT" (ミギ　ユク), "MOVE FORWARD" (マエ　ススム), "MOVE BACKWARDS" (ウシロ　ススム) or "GO UP" (ウエ　ユク). Enter "noun + ミル" if you want to look at something. Repeating an incorrect command that is not supported or cannot be given several times in the current situation will cause a ghost to appear and if you don't run away quickly it will be game over, so be careful.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is a storage room. The commands to be given is expressed in Japanese in katakana: "noun" + "space" + "verb". EXAMPLE: If you want to take something type "noun + トル".
Starting location. This is the entrance. To navigate through the locations type "GO LEFT" (ヒダリ　ユク), "GO RIGHT" (ミギ　ユク), "MOVE FORWARD" (マエ　ススム), "MOVE BACKWARDS" (ウシロ　ススム) or "GO UP" (ウエ　ユク).

Repeating an incorrect command that is not supported or cannot be given several times in the current situation will cause a ghost to appear and if you don't run away quickly it will be game over, so be careful. And yes. That is a Ultraman Poster.
Intro. I scream, you scream, we all scream and it is not for ice cream. Monsters to be precise.

title: Horror House
